Source code for straph.interval_tree.interval_tree

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from straph import stream as sg



[docs]class Node:
    def __init__(self, t_mid=None, elements=None, intervals=None):
        self.t_mid = t_mid
        self.intervals = intervals
        self.elements = elements
        self.left = None
        self.right = None
        if intervals:
            t = [i for sublist in intervals for i in sublist]
            self.min = min(t)
            self.max = max(t)
        else:
            self.min = None
            self.max = None


[docs]    def search_(self, t, results=0):
        if results == 0:
            results = {'elements': [], 'intervals': []}
        if self.max >= t >= self.min:
            for i, j in zip(self.intervals, self.elements):
                for t0, t1 in zip(i[::2], i[1::2]):
                    if t0 <= t <= t1:
                        results['intervals'].append([t0, t1])
                        results['elements'].append(j)
        if t >= self.t_mid:
            if self.right:
                return self.right.search_(t, results)
            else:
                return results
        elif t <= self.t_mid:
            if self.left:
                return self.left.search_(t, results)
            else:
                return results

        # elif t == self.t_mid:
        #     return self.intervals



[docs]    def get_global_min(self, global_min=None):
        if not global_min:
            global_min = self.min
        else:
            global_min = min(global_min, self.min)
        if self.right and self.left:
            return min(self.right.get_global_min(global_min), self.left.get_global_min(global_min))
        elif self.left:
            return self.left.get_global_min(global_min)
        elif self.right:
            return self.right.get_global_min(global_min)
        return global_min




[docs]    def get_global_max(self, global_max=None):
        if not global_max:
            global_max = self.max
        else:
            global_max = max(global_max, self.max)
        if self.right and self.left:
            return max(self.right.get_global_max(global_max), self.left.get_global_max(global_max))
        elif self.right:
            return self.right.get_global_max(global_max)
        elif self.left:
            return self.left.get_global_max(global_max)
        return global_max




[docs]    def search_interval_(self, I, results=0):
        if results == 0:
            results = {'elements': [], 'intervals': []}
        # Case One : easy case, t_mid is in I so we add the whole node
        #            to our results
        if I[1] >= self.t_mid >= I[0]:
            for interval,element in zip(self.intervals,self.elements):
                for t0,t1 in zip(interval[::2],interval[1::2]):
                    intersec_b = max(t0,I[0])
                    intersec_e = min(t1,I[1])
                    results['intervals'].append([intersec_b,intersec_e])
                results["elements"].append(element)
            # results['intervals']
        # Case Two : there is at least one intersection between the node's
        #            intervals and I
        elif self.min <= I[1] and I[0] <= self.max:
            for i, j in zip(self.intervals, self.elements):
                for t0, t1 in zip(i[::2], i[1::2]):
                    if t0 <= I[1] and I[0] <= t1:
                        intersec_b = max(t0, I[0])
                        intersec_e = min(t1, I[1])
                        results['intervals'].append([intersec_b,intersec_e])
                results['elements'].append(j)
        if self.right:
            if I[1] >= self.right.get_global_min():
                return self.right.search_interval_(I, results)
        if self.left:
            if I[0] <= self.left.get_global_max():
                return self.left.search_interval_(I, results)
        return results

        # elif t == self.t_mid:
        #     return self.intervals



[docs]class Interval_Tree:
    def __init__(self):
        self.root = None


[docs]    def add(self, node):
        if not self.root:
            self.root = node
        else:
            self.__add__(node, self.root)


    def __add__(self, node, parent):
        if node.t_mid == parent.t_mid:
            parent.intervals.append(node.intervals)
            parent.elements.append(node.elements)
        if node.t_mid > parent.t_mid:
            if parent.right:
                self.__add__(node, parent.right)
            else:
                parent.right = node
        if node.t_mid < parent.t_mid:
            if parent.left:
                self.__add__(node, parent.left)
            else:
                parent.left = node


[docs]    def create_nodes_from_intervals(self, list_elements, list_int):
        empty = True
        for i in list_int:
            if i:
                empty = False
                break
        if empty:
            return
        t_mid = find_median(list_int)
        elements_node = []
        elements_left = []
        elements_right = []

        list_node_tree = []
        list_left = []
        list_right = []

        for i, j in zip(list_int, list_elements):
            r_tmp = []
            l_tmp = []
            n_tmp = []
            for t0, t1 in zip(i[::2], i[1::2]):
                if t0 > t_mid:
                    r_tmp += [t0, t1]
                elif t1 < t_mid:
                    l_tmp += [t0, t1]
                else:
                    n_tmp += [t0, t1]
            if n_tmp:
                elements_node.append(j)
                list_node_tree.append(n_tmp)
            if l_tmp:
                elements_left.append(j)
                list_left.append(l_tmp)
            if r_tmp:
                elements_right.append(j)
                list_right.append(r_tmp)
        for i in list_node_tree:
            if i:
                self.add(Node(t_mid, elements_node, list_node_tree))
                break
        self.create_nodes_from_intervals(elements_left, list_left)
        self.create_nodes_from_intervals(elements_right, list_right)



[docs]    def search(self, t):
        return self.root.search_(t)



[docs]    def search_interval(self, I):
        return self.root.search_interval_(I)




[docs]def plot_tree(root, pos):
    # print("Plot pos :",pos)
    # print("T_mid :",root.t_mid)
    plt.plot([pos[0]], [pos[1]], 'ok')
    plt.annotate(str(root.t_mid),
                 xy=pos, xycoords='data',
                 xytext=(-50, 30), textcoords='offset points',
                 arrowprops=dict(arrowstyle="->"))
    if not root.right and not root.left:
        return
    if root.right:
        pos1 = (pos[0], pos[1] - 1)
        plot_tree(root.right, pos1)
    if root.left:
        pos1 = (pos[0] - 1, pos[1])
        plot_tree(root.left, pos1)




[docs]def print_interval_tree(N):
    try:
        N = N.root
    except:
        pass
    print("t_mid :", N.t_mid)
    print("Elements :", N.elements)
    print("Max :", N.max, " Min :", N.min)
    print("Intervals :", N.intervals, "\n")
    if not N.left and not N.right:
        return
    if N.left:
        print("Left child :")
        print_interval_tree(N.left)
    if N.right:
        print("Right child:")
        print_interval_tree(N.right)




[docs]def find_median(list_intervals):
    tot_t = [i for sublist in list_intervals for i in sublist]
    tot_t.sort()
    l = len(tot_t)
    if l % 2 == 0:
        return (tot_t[l // 2] + tot_t[(l // 2) - 1]) / 2
    else:
        return tot_t[(l + 1) // 2 - 1]




[docs]def search_overlap_intervals(root, results=0):
    return




[docs]def plot_intervals(list_int):
    '''
    Display in an elegant way a small stream graph
    We can also specify a path to save the animated of ploted stream graph
    :param animated: If we want an animation with cursor which move according to the time
    :return: A matplotlib plot
    '''
    lnodes = len(list_int)
    c_map = sg.get_cmap(lnodes)
    fig = plt.figure()
    for p, t in zip(range(lnodes), list_int):
        plt.axhline(p, linestyle='--', linewidth=0.7,
                    color=c_map(p), alpha=0.1)
        plt.hlines([p] * (len(t) // 2), xmin=t[::2], linewidth=1.1,
                   xmax=t[1::2], colors=c_map(p), alpha=0.9)




[docs]def plot_tree2(root):
    # print("Plot pos :",pos)
    # print("T_mid :",root.t_mid)
    plot_intervals(root.intervals)
    if not root.right and not root.left:
        return
    if root.right:
        plot_tree2(root.right)
    if root.left:
        plot_tree2(root.left)



if __name__ == '__main__':
    nodes = ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E', 'F']
    list_int = [[4, 8, 11, 17, 35, 40],
                [1, 3, 9, 10, 17, 19, 21, 22.5],
                [5, 15, 20, 22, 31.2, 34.8],
                [1.2, 5.4, 8.5, 10.6, 23, 24, 45, 50],
                [20, 22],
                [1, 15, 16, 35]]
    plot_intervals(list_int)

    n_inter = sum([len(i) / 2 for i in list_int])
    # print("N intervals :",n_inter)
    W = Interval_Tree()
    W.create_nodes_from_intervals(nodes, list_int)
    # print_interval_tree(W.root)
    # plot_tree(W.root, (0, 0))
    # plt.show()
    t = 10
    r = W.search(t)
    print("Intervals at " + str(t) + " :", r)
    print("Get global min right :", W.root.right.get_global_min())
    print("Get global max right :", W.root.right.get_global_max())
    print("Get global min left:", W.root.left.get_global_min())

    print("Get global max left:", W.root.left.get_global_max())
    I = [18.5, 20.5]
    r2 = W.search_interval(I)
    print("Intervals in " + str(I) + " :", r2)
    print_interval_tree(W)
